abstract: Facundo de Zuviría’s formal images of Buenos Aires storefronts shuttered during Argentina’s 2001 economic crisis reveal the city’s character in its rapidly-changing neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: Facundo de Zuviría’s muse is Buenos Aires, but far from the cosmopolitan climes of this Argentine capital. For him, the city reveals its true character in its barrios, where mom-and-pop stores occupy old, low-slung buildings. He had understood that in the 1980s when he worked in a cultural program that took him all over the city. But it really hit home during Argentina’s economic crisis in 2001.
snippet: Facundo de Zuviría’s formal images of Buenos Aires storefronts shuttered during Argentina’s 2001 economic crisis reveal the city’s character in its rapidly-changing neighborhoods....

headline.main: Finding a Muse in the Vanishing Neighborhoods of Buenos Aires
